commentBody:
"Gronkowski, wearing sunglasses ..., humped the stage, turned his back to the crowd, bent his legs and wagged his butt as though it were attached to a jackhammer. (He twerked, basically.)"
Now this, THIS, is journalism at its finest on the safari slay and bring back the stuffed "Bro"! My, the twists and turns you must have gone through to paste together yet another "i'm injured, offended, angry at the tsunamis of injustice that are always headed my way" article. Thank you Wesley and NYT. Maybe you and your editors can "stealth edit" when you find another great example to buttress your case or, perhaps, change the direction of the whole article on the fly as you've done in the recent past. This way, when people email it, unbeknownst to the senders, you can surreptitiously distribute an augmented or different message. Get it?
http://publiceditor.blogs.nytimes.com/2016/03/17/new-york-times-bernie-s...
